availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born March 16, 1815 in Indiana. He was Merchant and Banker in Owingsville, Bath County, Kentucky. Married Maria M. Smith on March 8, 1838. Lee Died on March 26, 1892. Buried in Owingville Cemetery, Bath County,Kentucky.

bibl.p: Find A Grave, "James Andrew Jackson Lee ( 1815 - March 26, 1893)," Memorial #80586018,https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=80586018&ref=acom (accessed June 27, 2017).; Elder John Sparks, Raccoon John Smith: Frontier Kentucky's Most Famous Preacher (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2005), 331.
